JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Solution Architect - Manufacturing, EAM or Project-oriented Business
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Company Description

At IFS you will work in a growing, global enterprise software company built upon committed and empowered colleagues who come to work knowing they are making a difference. We work every day within our single platform and embedded digital innovation to help our customers be their best when it really matters to their customers – at the Moment of Service™. We take pride in ensuring that our employees are able to achieve the company goals as well as develop their career. We believe empowered autonomy, committed colleagues and being part of a winning team are the keys to our success and what makes us great!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

 

Job Description

Do you want to use your industry and implementation experience to create and communicate well thought through practical solutions for our customers? Can you see both the big picture and the hidden details? Are you willing to take the lead in various implementation and transformation projects delivering IFS solutions which fit for our customers?

If yes, continue reading because IFS’s Global Consulting Services (GCS) Organization is on the lookout for a proactive and experienced individual to join our team as a Solution Architect in the area of manufacturing, enterprise asset management or project-oriented business solutions.

In this position you will be part of the IFS Nordics Architect Services team and have colleagues across Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden. This opportunity is a full-time permanent position reporting to a Senior Principal Solution Architect in Denmark. The office site is Copenhagen.

You will be responsible for leading all aspects of the solution, working closely with the IFS implementation team, as well as advising and guiding the customer project team. In practise this means:

  • Taking the lead in delivering the IFS solution, maintaining clear communication on all aspects of the solution with the customer project and management team.
  • Working closely with IFS’ Project Managers while coordinating and delegating work within the project team.
  • Applying your industry knowledge and experience in complex, multi-phase IT projects.
  • Articulating product direction and the potential value it could bring to our customers.
  • Maintaining the focus on ensuring we deliver value to the customer.

 

Qualifications

As a Solution Architect you will play a key role in delivering value to our customers. Great communication skills and a proactive approach to working with the customer and colleagues from IFS and partners are essential and the following elements will enable you to be successful in this role. We hope that you

  • are an expert in at least one of the following processes: manufacturing, enterprise asset management or project-oriented business solutions.
  • are experienced in leading a team and delivering solutions.
  • have work experience in one or more ERP systems and/or in complex IT implementations.
  • have advanced communication and presentation skills.
  • have a degree which supports your role in this job.

In addition to those:

  • Fluency in English is a must. Fluent Danish, Swedish and/or Norwegian is a huge plus.
  • We will require that you either hold a citizenship to Denmark or have a permanent work visa. 
  • Commercial focus, consultative mindset, good interpersonal skills, a will to learn and develop and a “can-do” attitude form a solid base for you career at IFS.

 

Additional Information

What you get:

  • Great challenges in delivering IFS solutions to large/global customers together with an experienced IFS team and our partners.
  • To work with a great product with good recognition in the market and amongst customers and analysts.
  • To work with our international contacts including our offshore, R&D and partner organizations.
  • Comprehensive onboarding program and a Buddy guiding you and how to become a successful IFS Solution Architect.
  • A Social Buddy who will help you getting to know your colleagues - no one is left behind.
  • A bunch of great colleagues and a fun group where everyone is helpful.
  • Flexible working hours and a possibility to work remotely every now and then.
  • A nice range of employee benefits.

Please submit your CV and tell us a bit about yourself and how you would fit in to this position no later than May 23, 2022. 

If you have any questions, please contact your future manager Lars (lars.kristensen[at]ifs.com).

As a step in our recruitment process, all final candidates will undergo an online Personal Profile Analysis to get us an understanding of our future employees. Our final candidate will also be asked to undergo a security check conducted by a third-party. 

We’re looking forward to hearing from you. Just apply now and tell us how you want to make a difference and impress us!

 

IFS FACT

IFS develops and delivers enterprise software for customers around the world who manufacture and distribute goods, maintain assets, and manage service-focused operations. The industry expertise of our people and solutions, together with commitment to our customers, has made us a recognized leader and the most recommended supplier in our sector. Our team of 4,000 employees supports more than 10,000 customers worldwide from a network of local offices and through our growing ecosystem of partners. For more information, visit: IFS.com
